results.title: The Local handyman
results.brief_description: The life of a typical English blacksmith showing the great variety of jobs that he is called upon to undertake. The film stresses the blacksmith’s modern methods, adapted to today’s needs, and his traditional craftsman’s attitude to his work.
results.description: The life of a typical English blacksmith showing the great variety of jobs that he is called upon to undertake. The film stresses the blacksmith’s modern methods, adapted to today’s needs, and his traditional craftsman’s attitude to his work.

results.title: The Lobster
results.headline_credit: France, Greece, Ireland, Netherlands and United Kingdom, 2015
results.brief_description: In a dystopian near future, single people, according to the laws of The City, are taken to The Hotel, where they are obliged to find a romantic partner in forty-five days or are transformed into beasts and sent off into The Woods.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs and Yorgos Lanthimos
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

results.title: The Living tundra
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, British Petroleum and Richard Brock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Web of life”.
A study of the ecology of the Alaskan tundra, showing it in winter when it is barren and locked in snow and ice, and in spring when flocks of wild fowl fly in and the tundra becomes covered in flowers.

results.title: The Living soil
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Nicholas Alexander and Roger Seccombe
results.brief_description: Without spoken commentary, this film depicts both the life of the soil and the life within it. The film also demonstrates through photography, the chemical cycle of soil. For many people soil is just dirt. Yet through the fresh eye of the camera, soil is seen as the home of a vital community.

results.title: The Living savanna
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, British Petroleum and Richard Brock
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Includes scenes of wildlife in East Africa and shows how the various animals fit into the ecosystem. Also shows the effects of any alteration to the balance of nature. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Living river
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, British Petroleum and Richard Brock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Web of life”.
Thoughtless actions by humans can easily upset the delicately adjusted balance of life in a river. Shows how the seasons, weather, flora and fauna of the River Test are all integrated and woven into a “web of life”. Includes underwater shots of birds feeding from the river bed and thousands of eels on migration.

results.title: The Living reef (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A program that gives a general description of the Great Barrier Reef, how it developed and the diversity of life found above and below water. It depicts the interdependence of the many different species of animal life inhabiting the Reef.

results.title: The Living reef
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description: The longest and largest reef in the world lies off the North-East Coast of Australia. The Great Barrier Reef extends from New Guinea to central Queensland.
